primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the life of an inadequate man (Gideon) and the history of an oppressed people (Israel) to demonstrate that deliverance comes solely from His power, not human strength.

tekstueel_bewijs: God allowed the Midianites to overrun them
God is capable of invading our lives and commandeering us
The Lord has given the Midianite camp into your hands

object.identificatie: The glory of God through the deliverance of Israel
tekstueel_bewijs: In order that Israel may not boast against me
demonstrate that His power [is] made perfect in our weakness

zender.identificatie: God as the Sovereign Lord of History

tekstueel_bewijs: save Israel out of the hand of Midian
kneels with us here before the altar
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Receiver (the weak/fearful) rather than the Subject.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Angel of the Lord
tekstueel_bewijs: the spirit of the Lord came upon Gideon
The angel of the Lord... magnanimously overlooks Gideon’s lack
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides His own Help.
helper.rol_van_geest: External endowment that transforms the Subject's competence.

tegenstander.identificatie: Human Pride (Vaunting) and the Midianite Oppression
tekstueel_bewijs: lest Israel vaunt themselves against me
the Midianites... like swarms of locusts
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a military force but the spiritual condition of self-reliance (vaunting) which God must actively dismantle.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Gideon's transformation from a skeptical, syncretistic thresher to a worshipping leader.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Gideon
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Gideon's action is a sub-program entirely dependent on God's primary action of 'commandeering' him.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → The demonstration of His own Invincibility

voorbeelden_god_subject: God allowed the Midianites to overrun them
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Gideon was attempting to thresh wheat
Gideon dashes off and fetches a little offering

voorbeelden: called his people to a life of obedient faithfulness
Do not desire to be strong
His power made perfect in our weakness
The power of God confounds the powerful

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Pouvoir-faire' (Power) discourse. It emphasizes that the Subject (Man) lacks the power to act, and the Object is achieved only through the divine 'Being Able'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Invasion) to ~S2 (Gideon's fear) to ~S1 (God stripping human numbers) to S1 (God's victory).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Cross' (Bonhoeffer quote), where God's power is revealed in the ultimate weakness.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the invasion is described with visceral historical detail.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the primary actor who initiates, sustains, and completes the narrative. Human participation is framed as a response to divine 'invasion' rather than a condition for it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Stirred by the words and the conduct of their charismatic leader

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God isn’t going to allow us always to keep him at a remote and pious distance... God is capable of invading our lives.
In order that Israel may not boast against me that her own strength has saved her.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Gideon is presented not as a hero to emulate, but as a weak vessel through whom God works. His 'valor' is a gift, not a trait.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: 'Gideon wasn’t in the least a mighty man of valor until God said so'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the pressure to be 'strong' is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation and its fruits are God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The primary program (God saves) and secondary program (Gideon acts) are perfectly integrated through the theology of the Cross.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God is invincible. His purposes will be accomplished. Those who serve him cannot be overcome.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) that the human subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin leads to the 'brutally destructive' consequences of judgment.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It systematically strips the human subject of competence to highlight divine agency.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a sermon on Judges.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon avoids the 'Gideon-as-hero' trap and successfully points to the 'Lord on the cross' as the true Subject of the story.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the vivid imagery of camels and torches, Greimasian analysis reveals that these images serve to diminish the human Subject's power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Midianites; semiotics explains why the Midianites *must* be overwhelming for the narrative logic of grace to function.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Axis of Transmission' where God is both the Sender of the mandate and the Provider of the competence to fulfill it.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses historical 'invasion' as a metaphor for divine 'invasion' of the soul.
